reviews.review_msg: The assignment and materials were fine and straight forward. The two quizzes and final were really hard. So really prep for quizzes and final.
Super course! The assignments and lectures are structured well. I like that we are given real data to practice the spatial statistics techniques. Overall a great course experience.

Get to know the TA for any class you take of hers and ask them questions. Prof not helpful with clarification in terms of what material will be tested. Material is interesting but delivery is somewhat underwhelming. Her lectures felt as though it was a chore for her as though she wanted to get it over with. Class is passable, would not recommend.
She is very nice, very patient and very helpful during office hour. Fair exams and fair marker. I got a C+ , but it's because I did not study hard. If you put effort in, guarantee a B for u.

What she asks of you is trivially easy; the way she asks it makes it nearly useless and incomprehensible. Dumbed-down, annoying, and worthless class. Should be revamped with a new instructor. Worst geography class I've taken. (BSC student)

The prof does an excellent job at explaining the stuff. I like the hands-on approach used in the lectures. I was a bit nervous about taking this Q course but now looking back I am glad I did. I am happy with the grade I got. These concepts come up all the time in GIS work. Thanks for a great course Suzana!
Excellent course and prof! Learn a lot of practical skills. She took the time to explain some class stuff to me during office hours. Fair prof. Will take more courses with her.
The course is well organized and delivered. Suzana does a good job at explaining the concepts. I learn some valuable Q skills that I am already using. Thanks Suzana.

I enjoyed this course despite a lot of it was about numbers and calculations. As a human geographer the skills I gained will give me an edge in the workplace. The teacher used some interesting examples for the assignments. I wish the software could be changed though.

This is a well organized course. The Prof was very considerate and helped willingly during office hours. The textbook was dry but I couldn't find anything else in the library. The TA was a bit picky with the marking.

I didn't find anything wrong with the course or with Suzana's teaching. I was at the labs and lectures and got a good grade. I know a few people who gambled on skipping lectures and expected a good grade. I guess those are the people with the vindictive comments below.

I am a science student and found the course to be very well structured and presented. Suzana tries her best to pitch the content to the mix of science and arts students. The arts students wanted spoon-feeding all the time. This course give me some good data analysis skills I needed for my co-op placement. Thanks Suzana!

Suzana is very knowledgeable in spatial statistics. I didn't like the software that much. Suzana encouraged me when I was having personal difficulties during the term. She is a kind person and I have a lot of respect for her.

Very well organized course. The teacher is good at explaining things. The content is a bit dry but that's not her fault. The in-class problem solving was nice. I learn a lot of useful things from this course.
Suzana was much nicer this semester (over fall 09). The course content is very dry and her voice IS quite annoying but TA Anthony is very helpful. If you try at the labs you will do fine.

Labs very easy, a bit time consuming but plenty of time to complete, TA very helpful, prof available. First quiz very easy, second quite a bit more challenging (but not unreasonable), same with third. Final did not seem too bad at all, was worried with these comments here.Hard to stay awake during lecture, dry stuff.

avoid!! seems that students are all stupid. Lab does not allow students to do something own their own to get a good mark. Have to always ask abt TA on every single question. If off the guied line which ever even told, lose lots of marks. Recommand that avoid if ur a science student.

Quizzes were fair but like other people say, the exam will be like nothing you have ever had.  It'll make you cry no matter how hard you study.  Lectures are ok, but hard to understand her at some times because of the language barrier.  Look elsewhere if you are considering taking a class with her.

Do you know what is gravity?
 Do you what is map?
 Lets all learn at kindergarten level.
 You either get 98, 99 or 100% through the course then hammered on the final.  I don't understand this style of teaching.  She was helpful but loses points on the murder final
Suzana's English is choppy, but she has a lot of heart. A more personable style than Nadine... not difficult class either. Recommended for GIS stuff.

This the third class I've taken with Shiv, I love this guy. He's really nice and if you just ask him, he will help you. His tests are hard but fair, you can't just straight up memorize his slides because he wants you to learn. You have to make sure you actually understand what he's teaching you, which is really what learning is.
